title: Outline of spirituality
text:
The following <a href="Outline%20%28list%29">outline</a> is provided as an overview of and topical guide to spirituality:
<a href="Spirituality">Spirituality</a> may refer to an ultimate or an alleged immaterial <a href="reality">reality</a>, an <a href="Involution%20%28philosophy%29">inner path</a> enabling a person to discover the essence of his/her being, or the “deepest values and meanings by which people live.”
<a href="Spiritual%20practice">Spiritual practice</a>s, including <a href="meditation">meditation</a>, <a href="prayer">prayer</a> and <a href="contemplation">contemplation</a>, are intended to develop an individual's inner life; spiritual experience includes that of <a href="connectedness">connectedness</a> with a larger reality, yielding a more comprehensive <a href="self">self</a>; with other individuals or the <a href="human">human</a> <a href="community">community</a>; with <a href="nature">nature</a> or the <a href="cosmos">cosmos</a>; or with the <a href="Divinity">divine</a> realm.
Paths.
Inner path.
"Inner path", as a <a href="Spirituality">spiritual</a> or <a href="religious">religious</a> concept, is referred to in:
